CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

1. "electron-donor polymers" - This is a general category of materials and not a specific material name.
2. "(i) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum" - This is not a specific material name, but rather a desirable characteristic.
3. "(ii) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives (typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC60 BM) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC70 BM))" - Here, the specific material names are:
	* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC60 BM)
	* [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC70 BM)
4. "(iii) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer" - This is not a specific material name, but rather a desirable characteristic.
5. "(iv) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes" - This is not a specific material name, but rather a desirable characteristic.

So, the specific material names in this paragraph are:

* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC60 BM)
* [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC70 BM)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC60 BM)
* [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC70 BM)

These are the only entities that clearly refer to Material Names in the given paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC60 BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC70 BM) |

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

1. "high power conversion efficiencies (PCEs)" - Here, "PCEs" is the property name entity referring to the power conversion efficiency.
2. "(i) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum" - Here, "good absorption spectral overlap" is the property name entity.
3. "(ii) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives" - Here, "optimal energy level alignment" is the property name entity.
4. "(iii) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer" - Here, "formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network" is the property name entity.
5. "(iv) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes" - Here, "provision of effective charge transport carriers" is the property name entity.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. "high power conversion efficiencies (PCEs)" - Here, "PCEs" refers to a material property, specifically the power conversion efficiency.
2. "good absorption spectral overlap" - Here, "good absorption spectral overlap" refers to a material property related to the absorption of light.
3. "optimal energy level alignment" - Here, "optimal energy level alignment" refers to a material property related to the energy levels of the material.
4. "nanoscale interpenetrating network" - Here, "nanoscale interpenetrating network" refers to a material property related to the structure and morphology of the material.
5. "effective charge transport carriers" - Here, "effective charge transport carriers" refers to a material property related to the ability of the material to transport charge.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

1. "high power conversion efficiencies (PCEs)" - Here, PCEs (Power Conversion Efficiencies) is the "Property Value" entity.
2. "good absorption spectral overlap" - Here, the degree of overlap in the absorption spectrum is the "Property Value" entity.
3. "optimal energy level alignment" - Here, the alignment of energy levels is the "Property Value" entity.
4. "nanoscale interpenetrating network" - Here, the structure and scale of the interpenetrating network is the "Property Value" entity.
5. "effective charge transport carriers" - Here, the effectiveness of charge transport is the "Property Value" entity.

These "Property Value" entities describe the desired characteristics of electrondonor polymers for achieving high power conversion efficiencies.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

3. "optimal energy level alignment" - Here, the alignment of energy levels is the "Property Value" entity.
4. "effective charge transport carriers" - Here, the effectiveness of charge transport is the "Property Value" entity.

These "Property Value" entities describe the desired characteristics of electrondonor polymers for achieving high power conversion efficiencies, and they clearly refer to the value of material properties.
